result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Michael Jensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Michael Jensen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott Michael Jensen was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Scott Michael Jensen appeared by phone.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Kieler appears by zoom. Court reviews request to stay jail sentence. Attorney Kieler heard on requests. Attorney Riniker does not object to the jail sentence being stayed. Court heard. Attorney Kieler heard on possible appeal. Court heard. Defendant heard. Court heard, grants request, and amends JOC to stay conditional jail time pending the expiration of appellate rights.

If you are unable to join by internet using video, you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 600-348-151). records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott Michael Jensen in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Scott Michael Jensen. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1. State moves to dismiss Cts 2 and 3. State will be recommending 10 years probation with the following conditions: participate in counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, sex offender registry for life, 1 year jail, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1. Court dismisses Cts 2 and 3 per agreement. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Kieler heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 10 years probation with the following conditions: participate in counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, pay court costs, submit a DNA sample, sex offender registry, and 1 year jail time with huber for work and family care, to report by Sept 18, 2022 at 6pm.
Character Letter-Rachel Freiburger
Character Letter- Karen Jensen

Defendant Scott Michael Jensen in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charge, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD and can not retain an attorney. Defendant to complete paperwork for court appointed attorney. State requests signature bond with a condition not to have any contact with Victim 1. Court orders $1000 signature bond with a condition to not have any contact with Victim 1. Status date set.
